N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 280.2 - Procedure

State Regulations
(a) Petition. In
order to obtain a determination pursuant to section 206 of the State

Administrative Procedure Act, a person shall file with the Office of Counsel, New York State Education Department, State Education Building, Albany, NY
12234, a petition, verified in the manner set forth in section
275.6
of this Title. Such petition
shall contain: (1)
a specific citation of the

State statute or rule involved; (2)
a specific citation of the Federal requirement involved; and
(3)
a clear and concise statement of the
reason petitioner asserts that compliance with the Federal requirement should
be accepted as compliance with the State requirement. (b) Memorandum of law. A petitioner may file
a memorandum of law in support of the contention that compliance with the

Federal requirement should be accepted as compliance with the State
requirement. Such memorandum of law shall be submitted at the same time the
petition is filed. (c) Additional
information. The commissioner may seek such additional information as he deems
appropriate prior to rendering a determination. Such information may be sought
from petitioner, or, upon notice to petitioner, from some other
source. (d) Determination. The
commissioner will issue a determination and/or a declaratory ruling as required
by section 206 of the State Administrative Procedure Act. Notes
